instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 - No keyboard (works with another mainboard)
threads.message:
Hi,

So this is a board that was purchased as a donor of eBay.
It would not power on and it actually ended up being in DFU mode.
After restore, it worked but not the keyboard. Luckily it wasn't iCloud locked.

As I have another MacBook Air same model, I did use this to do the DFU restore but the keyboard would not work.
Trackpad works however. Board looks pristine with no previous repair attempt.

Could it be the T2 detecting a different keyboard and disabling it.

I was able to do a PRAM reset it seemed (saw the Apple menu disappearing while doing the PRAM reset) 
I am also able to go into the boot menu to select the booting drive though I can't type anything in the Wi-Fi password menu at boot for example.
In OS mode, it doesn't react and Caps lock won't light up.

threads.title: 820-01521 - No keyboard (works with another mainboard)
threads.message: TrackPad works in boot menu and macOS too?

threads.title: 820-01521 - No keyboard (works with another mainboard)
threads.message:
Yes it does. I can use the trackpad to select the Wi-Fi network at boot menu.
I can also use it just fine in macOS.

threads.title: 820-01521 - No keyboard (works with another mainboard)
threads.message:
Keyboard connects through trackpad.
Check if all voltages are present at J6700, with correct values.
